body_html: No, it forces parallel regions to run in order, preventing their overlapping (due to outermost parallelism through TBB, Python threads or multiple processes) and thus preventing quadratic oversubscription. It cannot prevent oversubscription between 2 different thread pools though, e.g. TBB vs OMP if other TBB threads are not invoking OMP parallel regions. The worst performance hit is usually caused by quadratic oversubscription, but running < 2P threads does not usually cause that bad effects (though is still sub-optimal)

body: No, it forces parallel regions to run in order, preventing their overlapping (due to outermost parallelism through TBB, Python threads or multiple processes) and thus preventing quadratic oversubscription. It cannot prevent oversubscription between 2 different thread pools though, e.g. TBB vs OMP if other TBB threads are not invoking OMP parallel regions. The worst performance hit is usually caused by quadratic oversubscription, but running < 2P threads does not usually cause that bad effects (though is still sub-optimal)
